body:
Hello @sjdv1982! Thanks for updating the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/computation/engines.py`](https://github.com/sjdv1982/pandas/blob/45c7ac80e7af9cd8718a35a3479a4f46b03e6431/pandas/core/computation/engines.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/computation/eval.py`](https://github.com/sjdv1982/pandas/blob/45c7ac80e7af9cd8718a35a3479a4f46b03e6431/pandas/core/computation/eval.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/computation/expr.py`](https://github.com/sjdv1982/pandas/blob/45c7ac80e7af9cd8718a35a3479a4f46b03e6431/pandas/core/computation/expr.py) !



##### Comment last updated on December 11, 2018 at 16:27 Hours UTC

w/o tests this would not be acceptable. However, we do not deal with raw ndarray's at all as input here to ``.eval()``; so this is creaping out of scope. We have removed similar handling for all top-level pandas routines, so -1 on adding this back.

So If I understand correctly: for the Pandas project, ```core.computation.eval``` is meant for only DataFrames and Series in its global/local dict? If I want to use it for something else, I should spin it off?

> So If I understand correctly: for the Pandas project, core.computation.eval is meant for only DataFrames and Series in its global/local dict? If I want to use it for something else, I should spin it off?

not really sure what you are attempting to do in the first place.

> > So If I understand correctly: for the Pandas project, core.computation.eval is meant for only DataFrames and Series in its global/local dict? If I want to use it for something else, I should spin it off?
> 
> not really sure what you are attempting to do in the first place.

Instead of this (ugly):

```numexpr.evaluate("(s == 'Test') & (v > 3)", dic))```

I want this (clean):

```pd_eval("s == 'Test' and v > 3", dic)```
@sjdv1982 again I am not sure what you are actually trying to do. pls show a complete example.

> @sjdv1982 again I am not sure what you are actually trying to do. pls show a complete example.

[This](https://github.com/sjdv1982/struclib/blob/master/tests/viewer.ipynb). 

I am building a molecular viewer, and I want users to be able to use [clean selection syntax](https://pymolwiki.org/index.php/Selection_Algebra), no bitmasks.
closing. this is out of scope for pandas. all operations, by definition align. this is moving away from the core data structures.
